oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Music & the Spoken Word - Mormon Tabernacle Choir radio program - Episode 707 Part 2 - 1943-01-31 - KSL - WLAC
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Syndicated radio broadcast of the Music & the Spoken Word radio program, originally broadcast from KSL (Salt Lake City, Utah). Recorded from Temple Square in Salt Lake City, Utah, the program is narrated by Richard L. Evans, conducted by J. Spencer Cornwall, and performed by the Mormon Tabernacle Choir with Alexander Schreiner on organ. This is the second part of the 707th airing, recorded on January 31, 1943. Part one: TR004038_2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Mormon Tabernacle Choir; Alexander Schreiner
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (0:00) [Blank] / (0:29) Richard L. Evans introduces the next performance / (0:47) The Mormon Tabernacle Choir performs a largetto composed by George Frideric Handel / (4:05) Richard L. Evans reads a passage / (6:58) Alexander Schreiner performs "[Unconfirmed piece]" / (7:52) Richard L. Evans introduces the next performance / (8:25) The Mormon Tabernacle Choir performs a hymn composed by Charles Gounod / (12:35) Richard L. Evans announces the closing statements
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: CBS Inc.; Mormon Tabernacle Choir; Music and the spoken word (Radio program); KSL (Radio station : Salt Lake City, Utah); WLAC (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.)
